page.title: 10The Norman Church, Stoulton
page.content: The church has Norman arches and the windows are small because the cost of glass in medieval times was expensive. One of the chancel windows shows a woman spinning. Originally, the church had five bells but when the tower was being re-built, H.B. Kingsford increased them to six as a gift to the church. The largest of the bells weighs over 7 cwt. In the church grounds there is a graveyard which includes many village characters from the past - John Blizzard and his family of eleven who died out in 1816. Other famous names include the Ewins, the Smithins and the Hemus who have family graves in the church yard. The Church is dedicated to St. Edmund, King and Martyr. Its upkeep is expensive for a small community.
